subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Isis: The Goddess Who Conquered Rome
description: A short lesson to help you apply Isis: The Goddess Who Conquered Rome.

hook.text: An Egyptian goddess became Rome's most popular deity. Isis was worshipped from London to Afghanistan. She nearly won.

buildup.text: Isis was the goddess of magic, motherhood, and healing. Her cult spread along Roman trade routes across the empire.

discovery.text: Her worship featured initiation rituals, priests, and the promise of personal salvation. Sound familiar?

twist.text: Scholars debate whether Christianity borrowed from Isis worship: virgin mother, divine child, resurrection themes.

climax.text: Christianity replaced Isis. But images of Isis nursing Horus may have shaped depictions of Mary and baby Jesus.

punchline.text: Isis nearly conquered Rome's soul. Christianity won, but her echoes remain.

quiz.question: How far did the worship of Isis spread?
options: Across the Roman Empire from Britain to Afghanistan
